asdf Advancing intelligence in the 21st century

We leverage open source software and open development to provide secure and distributed intelligence capabilities to our customers.

Search & Discovery for the Intelligence Community

Our customers require access to vast amounts of data to perform their operations, we build on the Distributed Data Framework as the open source tool to make their mission easier.

Advancing the DCGS Family of Systems

Prime Developers of the DCGS Integration Backbone (DIB) to provide secure, flexible, enterprise intelligence capabilities.

Understanding the Importance of Coalition Partners

Today’s threats require international collaboration, we built the Collaborative Agile Gateway Environment for connecting partner nations through intelligence sharing.

Unlocking Vital Intelligence Information

With Reflex, we break down third party proprietary restrictions from intelligence sensors and make it so our users can gain access to all the data and make informed decisions.

UK MOD

Imagery Exploitation Programme

“In order to support CFACC [Combined Forces Air Combat Commander] intelligence needs, AF DCGS must be able to conduct time-dominant and decision-quality analysis to optimize ISR operations, produce timely assessments and enhance battlespace awareness and threat warnings,” said Lt. Col. Joshua P. Williams, AF DCGS Branch materiel leader. “To ensure rapid response to changing threats and intelligence, our team worked to develop an open and agile architecture, enabling a plug-and-play-type environment.” Source: 2016 Open Architecture Benefits DCGS

How We Do It

Connexta manages the open source DDF baseline, and provides enterprise solutions and technical support for DDF installations.
